newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian dlr firms slightly on S&P outlook.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian dlr firms slightly on S&P outlook.

text.p: The Australian dollar firmed slightly after Standard & Poor's said it was putting Australia on a positive outlook for its foreign currency rating.
At 1.22 p.m. (0322 GMT) the dollar stood at US$0.7881/86 from US$0.7873/78 before the S&P news.
"The market got up to US$0.7886/91, but it is looking toppy around there," one trader said, comfirming the tick up was on the back of the S&P announcement.
S&P said it had revised the outlook to positive from stable and affirmed Australia's long-term AA and A1-plus short-term foreign currency ratings.

"The outlook change reflects the substantial fiscal tightening implied by the Commonwealth Government's budget statement released yesterday (Tuesday) and Standard and Poor's expectation that Australia's net public external debt burden could decline markedly if this fiscal stance is maintained medium term," the ratings agency said.
